intro: Siphanthera capillaris, commonly known as the slender flame vine, is a climbing plant native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and showy, orange-yellow tubular flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are typically arranged in clusters. Siphanthera capillaris thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in tropical forests and along riverbanks.
